description: This is a Java Spring configuration class for setting up Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) rules for the backend. It reads environment variables to configure allowed origins, mainly for enabling secure cross-origin requests during development and production for a frontend-backend application.

classes.name: CorsConfig
classes.description: Configuration class that sets up a CORS filter for the application, allowing specified origins, headers, and methods based on environment variables.

methods.name: corsFilter
methods.description: Creates and registers a CorsFilter bean with configuration based on environment variables and local development defaults.

methods.name: isNonEmpty
methods.description: Helper method to check if a given string is non-null and not empty after trimming.
